Companion code for Callister+ 2021 (“Who Ordered That?”)¶

This page describes the code used to produce results presented in ArXiv:2106.00521, which can be accessed at:

https://github.com/tcallister/BBH-spin-q-correlations

In this paper, we sought to measure the degree of correlation between the mass ratio \(q\) and effective inspiral spins \(\chi_\mathrm{eff}\) of the binary black hole population observed by the Advanced LIGO and Virgo experiments. We found that, at high confidence, unequal-mass events (low \(q\)) systematically have larger \(\chi_\mathrm{eff}\), such that these parameters are anticorrelated. Applying this population fit as a new prior on the properties of LIGO/Virgo’s BBH detections yields the reweighted posteriors shown in the figure above.
